title: Fact Check-Photo shows electric cars in China, not France | Reuters

metatags.twitter:creator: @Reuters
metatags.og:description: Posts with a photograph of an abandoned car lot are falsely claiming it shows an electric car graveyard in France. Reuters fact-checked a similar claim in the past. The photo in question, however, does not illustrate this story, but was taken in Hangzhou, China.

metatags.twitter:title: This photo does not show an 'electric car cemetery' in France
metatags.og:title: This photo does not show an 'electric car cemetery' in France
metatags.og:description: A photo has been shared thousands of times in posts claiming it shows an "electric car cemetery" in France, where electric cars are purportedly dumped when their batteries wear out. The claim is false; the image in fact shows a Chinese rideshare company's cars parked on the outskirts of Hangzhou. The company's former manager said most of the cars were first-generation electric vehicles set to be replaced with newer models."Here is an electric car cemetery in France. Nobody wants to buy a used electric car when the battery wears out," reads this Facebook post published on July 7.
metatags.twitter:creator: @afpfactuel
